intro: Cynanchum rupicola, commonly known as the rock milkvetch, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found growing on rocky slopes and in dry, disturbed soils, showing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Cynanchum rupicola is also known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in its family.
